subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Bills have lost three in a row and four of five, but at least they are not the Browns. Cleveland has been mired in a round of “Am-not-Are-too!” since the veteran Jamal Lewis hinted that some players quit in the second half of a loss to the Broncos. Kick returner Joshua Cribbs, one of the few Browns having an excellent year, backed Lewis, but Coach Romeo Crennel was furious. Crennel could use a little less criticism and a little more yardage from Lewis, who does not have a 100-yard game this season. Brady Quinn did everything but win in his first start, producing 30 points, 239 passing yards and 2 touchdowns. Buffalo’s Trent Edwards has been less impressive lately; he has five interceptions and three fumbles during the Bills’ losing streak. ANDREW DAS.
